definition[0]: the value of a product, building etc based on the price that people are willing to pay for it, rather than the cost of producing it or building it
definition[1]: the total value of all the shares on a stock market, or the value of a particular company’s shares
definition[2]: how much people would be willing to pay for something, rather than a value calculated in another way
example[0]: The survey compared the market value of similar properties in different parts of the country.
definition[3]: the total value of all the shares on a stockmarket, or the value of the shares of a particular company
example[1]: The current market value of the firm’s equity finance is £1 million.
